title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Community Living (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a two hour interview, with almost 40 questions, most of them were personality based. None of the questions investigated skills or abilities at all. It was way too long for the pay.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you solved a problem in a creative way?

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Community Living
Interview Descriptions: Met with the hiring manager who asked me questions about my education and work experience. Basically hired on the spot. The interview was in person in their office with just the supervisor.

title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Community Living (Windsor, ON) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process can take a while because they hire in large groups at certain periods of time. There two to three rounds of interviewing followed by an intensive and informative orientation that is 2 weeks long.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here?
How would others know if you had a bad day?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Community Living (Saint Louis, MO) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was very nice during the interview.  They asked about past experience.  Questions were not difficult to answer and they really seemed to enjoy working at and cared about their organization.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Caregiver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Community Living (Kitchener, ON) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Wanted to know more about my educational background and why I would be fit for this job. Asked if i would be comfortable with personal hygiene and doing in home visits.
Interview Questions: they asked why i qualified for the job

title: Personal Support Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Community Living (Kitchener, ON) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: i did a one on one interview and It took an hour in which the expectation of the company was made known  to me and it was explained in detail what the company is into. Where i would be working and also my time availability.
Interview Questions: Conflict with fellow worker? What will I do

title: Support Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Community Living (Burlington, ON) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The questions were fairly simple and straight to the point, I used a lot of common sense and connected past experiences as well what i've learned in school, lots of scenario based questions, and then a written portion to the interview.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have to offer?

title: Personal Support Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Community Living (Toronto, ON) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward interview process. Two people interviewed me at the office for the personal support worker position. Asked for my qualifications and reviewed my resume with me asking me questions like what my primary responsibilities were in each position. More behavioural questions than skills-related questions, like what would you do if XX decided to XX? How would you care for XX if he XX.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Community Living?
